text:
Raskolnikov stepped into the tavern. 

He felt weary and alone. 

“Just a moment of company,” he thought. 

The master appeared, boots first, greasy waistcoat shining. 

He smirked, “What’ll it be?” 

Raskolnikov glanced at the counter. 

Two boys served, their faces grimy. 

Sliced cucumbers and dried bread lay rotting. 

The air was thick with spirits. 

He breathed deeply, longing for something more. 

“Is anyone here?” he whispered. 

Silence answered, heavy and suffocating. 

He sank into a corner, searching for solace. 

Outside, the world spun on, indifferent.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov, weary from isolation, feels an unexpected desire for company while in a filthy tavern.
